android.gameengine.icadroids.input

Class TouchInput

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.gameengine.icadroids.input.TouchInput

  • public class TouchInput
extends java.lang.Object
    TouchInput class that sets and handles the input and put the result in easy-to-use flags. Each flag can statically be accessed, they hold the values. Do not instantiate this class yourself, all you need are the static values.
    Author:
    Roel

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int maxFingers
      Change this value to increase the amount of fingers you can use. defaults to 10.
      private float newDistance 
      private float oldDistance 
      static boolean onPress
      TRUE when device receives input ; FALSE otherwise
      static boolean onRelease
      TRUE when device has no input/or loses input(ex: user removes his finger)
      static boolean pinch
      TRUE when space between two fingers decreases.
      static float scale
      gets the scaling factor that applies on zoom and pinch actions
      static boolean use
      Wether or not you want to use the touch input or not , set this flag to true if you want to use it.
      static float[] xPointer
      Use this when you want to check the location of multipletouches so POINTER_X[0] is the first finger, 1 is the second etc..
      static float xPos
      The relative X position of where the user touches on the screen and NOT the actual game.
      static float[] yPointer
      the Y value of multiple touches.
      static float yPos
      The relative Y position of where the user touches on the screen and NOT the actual game.
      static boolean zoom
      TRUE when space between two fingers increase.
      private boolean zoomCheck

    • Field Detail

      • use

        public static boolean use
        Wether or not you want to use the touch input or not , set this flag to true if you want to use it. Note that only one touch Listener may be active at the time.

      • maxFingers

        public static int maxFingers
        Change this value to increase the amount of fingers you can use. defaults to 10.

      • onPress

        public static boolean onPress
        TRUE when device receives input ; FALSE otherwise

      • onRelease

        public static boolean onRelease
        TRUE when device has no input/or loses input(ex: user removes his finger)

      • xPos

        public static float xPos
        The relative X position of where the user touches on the screen and NOT the actual game.

      • yPos

        public static float yPos
        The relative Y position of where the user touches on the screen and NOT the actual game.

      • zoom

        public static boolean zoom
        TRUE when space between two fingers increase.

      • pinch

        public static boolean pinch
        TRUE when space between two fingers decreases.

      • scale

        public static float scale
        gets the scaling factor that applies on zoom and pinch actions

      • xPointer

        public static float[] xPointer
        Use this when you want to check the location of multipletouches so POINTER_X[0] is the first finger, 1 is the second etc..

      • yPointer

        public static float[] yPointer
        the Y value of multiple touches.

      • oldDistance

        private float oldDistance

      • newDistance

        private float newDistance

      • zoomCheck

        private boolean zoomCheck

        public TouchInput()

    • Method Detail

      • onTouch

        public boolean onTouch(View v,
              MotionEvent event)
        DO NOT CALL THIS FUNCTION. This is the standard function android provides for touch events. This class checks for the static values he need to change.
        Parameters:
        v - the View that android requires
        event - the event that this function catches.

      • actionPress

        private void actionPress(MotionEvent event)
        sequence of actions it should perform on a press event
        Parameters:
        event - the incoming MotionEvent

      • actionCancel

        private void actionCancel(MotionEvent event)
        sequence of actions it should perform on a canceling event
        Parameters:
        event - the incoming MotionEvent

      • calculateScaling

        private void calculateScaling(MotionEvent event)
        calculates wether the user peforms a zoom or a pinch
        Parameters:
        event - the event from OnTouch

      • spacing

        private float spacing(MotionEvent event)
        calculates the space between two fingers/pointers
        Parameters:
        event - the event to pass to this function
        Returns:
        a float that specifys the amount of distance between two fingers

      • setPositions

        private void setPositions(MotionEvent e)
        updates the positions of all the pointers/fingers.
        Parameters:
        e - the event to pass to this function.
